channel.title: aws on jamie.so
channel.description: Recent content in aws on jamie.so

item.title: chamber
item.author: jbgmoore@gmail.com (jamie moore)
item.description: Secrets management … the bane of automation in enterprises! If you are lucky enough to use aws parameter store and kms (every SecArch loves kms, so that part should be straight forward). Then you can manage your secrets using chamber. A tool that allows you to read a secret from parameter store and place them in your environment. It pairs fantastically well with aws-vault for identity management. Excellent to use as glue between an encrypted secret in parameter store and terraform.

item.title: aws-vault
item.author: jbgmoore@gmail.com (jamie moore)
item.description: Need to use the awscli and don’t have time to implement federation? Can’t connect to existing identity systems due to the skunkworks nature of your project? Have many seperate clients and aws accounts to deal with? aws-vault is here to save you.

item.title: awscli and jq
item.author: jbgmoore@gmail.com (jamie moore)
item.description: Ah the classic partnerships, hot chocolate and marshmallows , hot dogs and sauce, hot aws cli and jq. Some days the GUI just won’t easily tell you what you want to know. The AWS CLI and jq to the rescue!
